boat.name: Happy Quest
boat.full_description:
12 ton T.M. Centreboard Gaff Cutter, with Rounded Stem, Long Straight Keel & Transom Stern.

Designed & built by D. H. Grainger at Pembroke Dock.

Iroko Carvel Planked with Splined Seams.

Bottom Copper Sheathed with 20g Copper Sheets. Begun in 1978, Launched in 1995. Registered No. 711951, Port of Registry – Milford Haven, Register Tonnage 7.05 L.O.A. 30’ 4”, L.W.L. 27’ 4”, Beam 10’10”, Draft 3’10” (ex C.B), 6’ 10” (C.B. down)

Displacement approx 8 tons (fully laden), Iron Ballast Keel 3.2 tons, No inside ballast. Plain (Working) Sail Area 634 sq.ft., Lowers 577 sq.ft., Maximum Sail Area 1,043 sq.ft
boat.construction_details:
Carvel. 1 1/8” Iroko Planking bronze-bolted to 3½” x 2½” Sawn Frames every 2’ 6”, 
with 3 - 1¼” x 1” Steamed Oak Timbers copper-fastened between. 
Seams splined throughout, Topsides coated with Epoxy Resin, and painted. Bottom coated with hot Pitch, Copper Sheathing bedded in hot Pitch over Tarred Paper also bedded in hot Pitch.
Cast Iron Keel – 3.2 tons      (No inside ballast)         Centreboard Jarrah and Greenheart.
Main Deck 1” Plywood, sheathed with Glass-fibre in Epoxy Resin.
Coachroof ½“ (¾“ in way of hatch openings and tabernacle)
boat.short_description: Happy Quest was built by her owner, David Grainger, 1977 - 1995.

for_sales.sales_text:
I am reluctantly “downsizing" due to advancing years (mine, not hers!) after many seasons of wonderful sailing. It is important to me that a new owner will cherish her with the attention she deserves.

Designed and built without an engine she has always manoeuvred under her own canvas with very few exceptions. In spite of her weight and wide beam she sails well in all wind strengths being easy on the helm, well-balanced, responsive and close-winded. She has always performed creditably in OGA events.

Wintered each year ashore under cover in the shed in which she was built, she has been well maintained and is in good condition throughout.

She has cruised widely on the West coast, from the Hebrides to Belle Ile and Achill Head to Looe, visiting a total of over 125 ports and anchorages.

She comes with all her cruising equipment(except Sextant and Chronometer), a Neptune wind-vane Self-steering gear, a comprehensive sail wardrobe and a substantial Yard Trailer.

A full description of “Happy Quest" on DVD can be obtained on request from me.

Lying afloat and in commission at Pembroke Dock.
